result.execSummary:
The defendant Matthew R Langdon was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Bail Jumping-Felony, a class H felony, Wisconsin Statutes 946.49(1)(b).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

miscConds.notes: Pay all court costs and supervision fees. Defendant must submit a DNA sample as required by law and pay for the testing. If supervision is revoked or discharged with outstanding financial obligations, a civil judgment shall be entered against the defendant and in favor of restitution victims and governmental entities for the balance due.  Collections may include income assignment.
Enroll at Gateway and attend school full-time. Obtain high school diploma or equivalent.
Alcohol assessment and follow through with recommendations. No alcohol, random UA's at discretion of agent.

Drug assessment and follow through with recommendations. No controlled substances, random UA's at discretion of agent.  Do not associate with any known drug dealers or users.  Defendant may only take medication pursuant to a prescription.

No contact with the victim (person, property, residence or family). No contact with co-defendants. No contact with any gang members. Defendant must complete a Mental Health assessment and follow-through with recommendations. Follow current mental health treatment. Live with aunt and follow all her rules, Agent may aprove change of residence. Seek a mentor/sponsor. Write a letter of apology.  Voting prohibited until sentence is complete and civil rights have been restored.  Firearm warning given.

timeConds.notes: Defendant to complete community service hours during term of probation.

supervisions.notes:
**CORRECTED to list CFTS that defendant is entitled to**.   

** AMENDED 05-21-2018:  CFTS
Concurrent with: 14CF281

superMiscConds.notes: Any counseling deemed appropriate by agent; specifically AODA assessment, treatment and after care as well as mental health assessment and follow through.  Must obtain and maintain full time verifiable employment or attend full time or a combination of both equal to full time. Must obtain high school diploma or HSED. Firearm warning given. Voting is prohibited until sentence is complete and civil rights have been restored. Defendant must obey all rules and regulations while on supervision.

Charges per attached criminal complaint.   It is a condition of this bond that the defendant be placed on electronic monitoring.  Zimmerman Consulting Inc (ZCI), located at 524 S Main St in Racine (262-632-1780) to monitor.  You are to report to their office immediately following your hearing or your release from custody.  Defendant must live with mother and follow all house rules. Defendant to attend all medical appointments. No contact w/victims or co-defendants. Curfew 6pm. May be employed w/verification. Failure to appear will result in the issuance of a warrant for your arrest, possible bail jumping charges and forfeiture of any bond on deposit.
